title: Windspeakers blessing isn't a well designed keystone
body:
Just saying.  It doesn't promote unique playstyles, compliment them or require any effort on the players part to activate.

I'm not saying any of the keystones are particularly well designed but windspeakers is about one level noticeably lazier than the rest.

replies.body: You are crazy if you think windspeakers blessing isnt good. You can take this keystone on any healer or shield support, hell ive even tried this keystone om vladimir a few times because it increases vlads healing by 10%
OP isn't saying it isn't good, they're saying it isn't well designed.

If a keystone was hard to activate, they wouldnt be used. Fairly simple there really.

The keystones are not meant to be hard or "require any effort to activate". Windspeakers blessing compliments healing and shielding play styles such as me going Face of the Mountain, Locket of the Iron Solari, Redemption, and something like Knights Vow on Thresh.
I even take Windspeaker's Blessing on my Lux support because the additional shield buff is so good on a teamwide shield like Prismatic Barrier. It's perfectly fine as is.
sorry sweetie but supports are 100% perfect

While I agree to an extent, because of its function and intended users and the way it is activated, I don't think it is a problem in its case.
I would love to hear suggestions for a substitute tho.

What are you talking about - the ShieldPowerBuildpaths are solely viable due to Windspeakers!
And this IS unique!
